Bio

Howdy! I am currently a 2nd year Ph.D. student at Texas A&M University, advised by Dr. Shuiwang Ji, the leader of the Data Integration, Visualization, and Exploration (DIVE) Lab. I got my B.E. from University of Science and Technology of China in Computer Science and Technology (honor class) in 2020.

My research interests are general machine learning and deep learning. Specifically, my interest topics include Out-of-Distribution generalization, causality, and explainability especailly for graph data.

News

    09/2022
    Our paper GOOD: A Graph Out-of-Distribution Benchmark has been accepted by NeurIPS on Datasets and Benchmark track!
    08/2022
    Our paper Explainability in graph neural networks: A taxonomic survey has been accepted by TPAMI.
    12/2021
    We won the 3rd place of Open Catalyst Challenge 2021.
    09/2021
    Our paper DIG: A Turnkey Library for Diving into Graph Deep Learning Research has been accepted to JMLR.
